ygData.subject: DPH has crossed the line, accidentally.
ygData.msgSnippet: Yep, I have crossed a certain line.  You see, my mega archmage has so much magic power that the number is displayed as a negative number. The perks are that I

Subject: DPH has crossed the line, accidentally.
Message-ID: <923dlg+7tfp@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1009
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: "dph of rules " <dph_of_rules@...>

Yep, I have crossed a certain line.  You see, my mega archmage has so 
much magic power that the number is displayed as a negative number.  
The perks are that I can go through any scenario now as if I had never 
played it.  The bad is my mega archmage can not perform any attacks. 
:-(

His stats are as follows: str 3000; dex 3000; con 3000; int 7000; 
armor 3000; level 525.  I guess he could be considered forced into 
retirement. :-(.  It is not fair.  I only wanted to be able to perform 
any attack without the possibility of running out of magic power 
unless time was frozen.  :-(  Is that too much to ask?

Could someone at FSGames please give me a formula I can use to make 
sure that in the future, none of my characters accidentally crosses 
over with having too much magic power?  I promise not to share the 
formula with anyone else or use the formula to create a game of my 
own.

BTW, I would like to ask for the title of Expert on all characters 
whose experience level is greater that 100.
